intro: Boraginella heliocharis, commonly known as the suncharis, is a small, flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family, which includes many plants with characteristic blue or violet flowers. The species is typically found in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in sunny, well-drained environments. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in shades of blue or purple, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. The plant is relatively short-lived, often growing to only a few centimeters in height.
